Io e la mia famiglia abbiamo scelto l'hotel Belvedere proprio per la posizione, l'hotel si trova sulla 48 strada a pochissimi passi da Time Square, Broadway ecc.,quindi si raggiungevano a piedi tranquillamente. L'hotel si presenta bene, anche se le camere sono un po' datate. Noi abbiamo avuto un " problemino "di scarico ma comunque risolto in breve tempo.La colazione troppo costosa! Noi uscivamo e nelle vicinanze trovavamo cio' che ci serviva. Dunque un hotel senza troppe pretese ma in ottima posizione !

Have stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza before so I knew the hotel would meet all my expectations. Spent the 4th of July night there and was checked in promptly with no issues. One negative (though minor but still rare for a top notch hotel like the Copley Plaza) was that the staff was not attentive when we walked in with bags. No attempt to help us and even after checking in ... no attempt to bring our bags up to our room (the front desk didn't even ask if we had bags and if we needed help). It's an oversight worth noting (even though I am very capable of handling my own bag) because you would not expect this and never experienced it prior. The room was laid out perfectly and plenty of space. Another minor thing that completely stood out was the half empty bottle of water just sitting on the table. Big oversight for a first rate hotel (and a bit gross since it leads you to question how thorough they clean). The room did appear clean though and the bed was comfortable. Ordered room service and it came up promptly and hit the spot. We ordered extra towels and said we would be leaving the room and to leave them on the bed. No one delivered them. We called again and eventually got them upon our return. The small "misses" are noted because of the hotel wanting to be a 5 star facility and my prior experience being so positive. Had breakfast the next day in the Oak Room and it was excellent.

I traveled to San Antonio with a friend who RAVED over Starwood properties (Westin, W Hotel, La Meridian were all hotels she had stayed in), so i couldnt wait to see this property. However, i was VERY surprised at what i saw. I guess i am not "up" with the whole Manhattan loft concept, but i don't think this is great for an extended stay for a woman in her 40's and up who is used to the comforts of home.
Yes, it was clean, but as others have stated here on reviews, the walls inside the room are THIN--it essentially feels like one room with partitions. Not to be too gross, but if you are in the room when someone else is in the bathroom, since there is NO exhaust fan to mask sounds....let's just say--you can hear everything--best turn that 42" TV up !
The beds were comfortable, and in general, i didn't hear any of the hall or parking lot noise others mentioned (we were on the 3rd floor), so sleeping was good overall. i think that room cleaning could have been better, i am used to the room looking like it had never been used (esp. in the bathroom) with all amenities replenished when you return to the room. We had to ask several times for extra towels for the 3 of us, and, unless you put the towels on the floor, they didn't tend to bring enough back. and what's with that midget ironing board??!?!
Also, having both a refrigerator AND a Microwave would have been better, especially for those who are staying longer than 2-3 nights, cause it can get irritating going up and down the elevator reheating foods. Just a thought.
I think the foods in the "re:fuel" snack bar were WAY overpriced, so the only thing i had was coffee in the room...
Overall, i think this concept is geared for the younger crowd, but not what i expected from a hotel that has hotels like La Meridian and the W. The price was right for the hotel (we got a "hot rate"), so if i would have paid more, i think i would have been more disappointed... i would recommend only really for the location; Target, Dennys, Pappadeaux, Wal-mart and the North Star Mall, were all very nearby. There are a LOT of places to go to up and down the 410 highway. Getting back and forth to the the hotel can be confusing, so bring your GPS!! :-)

It has a great bar and a wonderfully unusual French atmosphere that makes this hotel stand out. (Since Sofitel is a French chain this should not surprise but it's done very well here). If you're sick of cookie cutter properties, stay here.

I am greatly impressed with the fact these are processed in a facility with only tree nuts. Aside from that, the taste is very good and the volume is a great value for the price. My only criticism would be the initial bag seal on one of the bags I ordered. It wasn't sealed, and that is upsetting. The other bag was sealed, so I can assume it is likely a manufacturing issue. In the future please ensure these bags are sealed!!

We stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend 2009. The location could not be beat. We walked to restaurants, Millenium Park, Chicago River Cruise. The price was super and the room was great. We had a microwave and mini refrigerator in our room.

The place was very nice very clean the room was super comfy and cozy. I can honestly say if you avoid some people at the front desk your experience would be 5 stars. Most of the staff is very polite except for one man at the front desk always rude. When I arrived one of the keys i was given did not work I realize that later on that day when i tried to use it. I went downstairs to ask for another key. I was not angry i was pretty happy with the room I was looking toward everything we had planned, so i was in a good mood. he started accusing me that because i had my key next to my phone it got demagnetized. I explained i did not that i had both keys in the envelop he gave me and that one worked the other did not. He continued to pretty much scold me like i was a kid. I'm trying to not lose it so i put my phone down it happen to be right next to the key and then he goes you see you put it next to your phone just like that and that is why it doesn't work. so now I'm confused does he want me to pay for another key?? if so say so charge me don't yell at me. I asked him do i have to pay for another one if not then can i have the key?
he finally gave me the key. I had to encounter him a few other times and the same treatment i tried avoiding the front desk when he was there. If you do go just avoid him and it will be a pleasant stay.
Fast, polite, and painless. And they didn't try too up sell me a ton, which most places do. I will definitely be returning!!

Visited this place for the 1st time tonight. Quite unexpected. Complimentary valet parking was nice. Inside was bright, airy and large. Very relaxed atmosphere with a fine dining twist. I had new foods tonight that I've never even heard of! Delicious appetizer to start with of Hummus and Baba Ganoush. That was super yummy!\nThey had $5 burgers tonight. It was a chirizo beef patty with swiss cheese, lettuce, tomato, red onion and a spicy mayo...served with shoestring fries. Total experience was fabulous. I was impressed with the service, the quality of the food and the total atmosphere. \nI will visit again.

It pays to have an AAA membership. We recently had a battery issue and needed assistance since it was 7:30am and we had to get to work. We purchased a battery from AAA the last time we had an issue since our previous battery died. Anyways, Tom from AAA Arizona Mobile Battery Service came to our aid swiftly and our car was running in no time. He was friendly and very helpful. Thank you, Tom!
Very good except for excessive ads during the play of some artist's songs.

We stayed here the night before boarding ship for an Alaska cruise. The location is right next door to the cruise terminal @ pier 66 (for NCL cruises). Arriving at night, the view of the harbour and city is fabulous, and waking up and pulling the drapes to see your cruise ship is wonderful. The water facing balcony room is more expensive, but if you can afford it...it's worth it. The room is huge with a big flat screen TV.
Since we got in late, we ordered from the room service menu and the fish and chips was plentiful, fresh and delicious.
The service in the dining room for breakfast was a little slow, but we had a rookie waitress. The people in the hotel are all very friendly and guest services were very helpful with giving me directions to walk to Pike Place Market which is a about a 10 minute walk. Check out the market, it is really cool with cheap bouquets of flowers ($5 - $15!!), seafood, restaurants and the usual t-shirt, knick knacks, artwork and jewellry. There is a shuttle from the hotel to downtown as well.
The day of the cruise, the bell hop took our luggage to the terminal, so we simply walked to the ship...and saved the cost of a cab!
The novelty and convenience of staying at The Edgewater is well worth the cost IMO.

Recommended.
This cookbook is a cultural adventure with all types of delicious foods. If you're looking for something different than a "Mediterranean diet"-type cookbook, try to find this book. It's a winner. There is a wide range of recipes; the author clearly both loves and is deeply knowledgeable about her subject matter, and she clearly explains where she has made alterations and why. Recommended.
Visit again

Primanti's is a local food. For anyone like me who grew up in the Pittsburgh area, your brain is already hardwired for borderline obsession with this product. However, if you're a first-timer, you might love it, you might hate it. Or maybe it will take you a few tries and it will grow on you. That seem to be the case for any regional fare. If it were a food that everyone instantly loved, Primanti's would be a national chain. But thank goodness it's not, because the nostalgia of this Pittsburgh, blue-collared staple would be lost anywhere outside the city. (But who am I kidding, I'd probably visit the Florida locations, too, if I were in the area.) \n\nYou may not love it, but you owe it to yourself to at least try it.

I recently flew with Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to Denmark through Singapore return trip with my 4-year old.
As it turned out, I got caught in the SAS pilot strike on a connecting flight when I had to return to Melbourne, and if it hadn't been for Singapore Airlines' brilliant customer service, I would have been stuck! Within 6 hours of emailing Singapore Airlines, I had a customer representative calling me offering me an alternative flight home, re-booked at NO EXTRA COST!! I am super impressed and grateful, and this is one of the reasons why I ALWAYS try to book Singapore Airlines before any other airlines!
Service and comfort on board the flights (MEL - SIN, SIN - CPH and AMS - SIN, SIN - MEL) were great with extra attention being paid to my pre-schooler with plenty of chats and making sure he was entertained. The child meals are also great, and I find it fantastic that they are served first, about 20-30 min before the normal meal service, giving a parent the chance to help feed the kid first and be able to eat my own meal while warm :-)
Superb excellent apps

Rachel Griffiths writes and directs this award winning short film. A heartwarming story about coping with grief and cherishing the memory of those we've loved and lost. Although, only 15 minutes long, Griffiths manages to capture so much emotion and truth onto film in the short space of time. Bud Tingwell gives a touching performance as Will, a widower struggling to cope with his wife's death. Will is confronted by the harsh reality of loneliness and helplessness as he proceeds to take care of Ruth's pet cow, Tulip. The film displays the grief and responsibility one feels for those they have loved and lost. Good cinematography, great direction, and superbly acted. It will bring tears to all those who have lost a loved one, and survived.

Frost is by far my favorite dessert place. Every flavor I have ever tried was delicious. Of course I have my favorites like the Sea Salt Caramel and the Bellini! So good! There is usually a line and its usually out the door. It always goes very fast even though the employees behind the counter let you try as many flavors as you want. I love that they pass out cups of water while you are in line or sitting down enjoying your gelato. This place is always clean and well kept. A family favorite and we frequent Frost often.

Great hotel to stay in for business. The King suite was really comfortable. The concierge was excellent. The front desk staff was really helpful. Great restaurants on either side of the hotel (though a bit pricey). Would have really been better if the hotel had a hotel or jacuzzi, but for business purposes, it was perfect.

Everything about our dining experience was absolutely superb! Outstanding service and some of the most delicious steak ever. The salad bar is incredible too! I highly recommend it.

Clean, comfy rooms and friendly, efficient staff - great late food delivery recommendation (Kick Backs). It was just what we needed for a family vacation road-trip stop-over. The hotel is just off I-95 and easy to find. In the morning there's a Starbucks a few blocks away for refueling before heading-up the I-95 on-ramp.

I thought it was worth every penny. We had the omakase to celebrate our tenth anniversary. Everything was delightful and what a treat to watch the chef create each dish! definitely a splurge but we will remember it for a long time.

We were going to go to another restaurant, however, they were in the process of closing, so we went for a walk and found this restaurant instead. The ambient lighting was we wanted, the waiter came by and handed our menus after looking at them for what seemed like forever we asked which meals was the best seller. We had a combo meal. One thing that bothered me was the wait staff seemed a little too eager to help or clear our table, I was still eating when they took my plate away. The portions were the right size, due to having had stomach surgery a few weeks ago. About 11pm the power went out, we couldn't get our receipt for the meal which I am told is quite common in Malaysia.

This is a favorite spot downtown for great service, beer and food. The happy hour specials are fantastic. They have a wonderful beer selection. And hands-down the best tasting fully loaded Bloody Mary ( won Best of Phoenix).

This hotel is very nice. We were on the 2nd floor and wasn't bothered by the guest above or below. The pool was very nice. The cool air in the pool room was very COLD. The staff was wonderful! Nice clean and friendly. I would recommend to all.

Great selection of dishes prepared in the North Indian style. The decor is kept simple but neat and staff are attentive. Prices are reasonable and comparable with other such restaurants. Weekdays are crowd free and one can opt for a leisurely dining experience.

The hotel is located in downtown Ft. Worth, directly across from the Ft. Worth Water Gardens and the convention center. While on the outer edge of the downtown area the hotel is still very convenient to shops and restaurants that you can either walk to if you don't mind a little exercise or using the free Molly Trolley which stops directly outside the hotel. The staff is very helpful and I received service above and beyond by Steven , one of the bell captains who has been working in Ft. Worth hotels for over 20 years.
My room was clean and comfortable and with free wi-fi, a pretty good value as well.
If I had one complaint it would be the lobby coffee shop which served up overpriced pastries and drinks, but that is pretty common amongst most hotels.
If you are staying in Ft. Worth this property is definitely worth considering.

I previously saw the mus.i.c show at the MGM Grand and wasn't sure if there was going to be a big difference compared to the show at Monte Carlo. But since I enjoyed the show so much the last time, I decided to go watch it again. If you get tickets early, you can probably find some discount through the Monte Carlo website, I got my tickets for 30% off. I definitely recommend sitting in the main floor close to the center aisle so that you get a full view of everything that's going on. 

The show is a bit different from the show at the MGM, the production value is higher so the costumes and the set got an upgrade. If you've seen the show at the MGM, the story line is about the same but they added some new routines and the best part, they took off their masks at the end =), not sure if they are doing that at the end if every show or what but they didn't do that before. 

The Monte Carlo theatre is bigger and the seats are like the movie theater seats (all individual). At the Hollywood theatre at the MGM, some seats were in a booth and they packed 6 people into one tiny booth and it was a uncomfortable but the Hollywood theatre was smaller so it felt more intimate there. But definitely check this show out =), the tickets are very reasonable for a Vegas show, they even have meet and greet passes but no discount for those =(.

We recently stayed for 4 nights at the Casablanca Hotel and we would go as far as saying it is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The staff were so friendly and helpful from the time we arrived we were a bit early to check in but they told us to help ourselves to the refreshments until the room was ready, they knew the visit was partly for my parents Ruby wedding anniversary and they left a complimentary bottle of wine in the room, a nice touch. The room was on the 6th floor and was quiet with all the facilities you would want and a good size room, the turn down at night with new towels etc was also appreciated. The complimentary refreshements during the day were also appreciated when returning from a day out or evening at theatre. Location could not be better yards from times square yet well sound proofed and quiet. Would definitely recommend and would certainly like to come again!!

I stayed in a private room with a shared bathroom for three nights. The room was quite small and didn't have any AC but you could open the window to let in air. The walls were quite thin - I heard the people next door, plus lots of people walking up and down the corridor at night. There was a fridge in the room but no coffee/tea maker - thankfully, Starbucks was just around the corner.
The bathroom and toilet were ok considering it was a shared facility. The toilet flooded on the last day I was there.
The central location was probably one of the main reasons I picked the hotel. I was able to walk around the city and didn't feel too unsafe at night when walking back to the hotel, despite the neighborhood.
I was able to borrow a hairdryer from the front desk and also print out my boarding pass.
If you have heavy luggage, it's quite a struggle to get to the front desk and your room as you have to walk up a flight of stairs.
There are lots of hotels in the area so I probably wouldn't stay here again.

This hotel is now formally a Fairfield Inn and Suites, one of the Marriott brands. I have been an occasional business customer over the years and wouldn't hesitate to be a repeat customer. Yes, renovation continues, but what the critics don't mention is how much improvement in the property can be bought with 4.5 million dollars.
The makeover is impressive, and you're met with a lobby that has been completely renovated. It's bright, welcoming, and user friendly, with a business work area that includes computers, internet access, printing capacity, etc. Check in was responsive and fast, as was checkout. In the interim I experienced their breakfast offering, which was more than adequate. In addition to the requisite cereal, bagels, OJ, etc. they offer the capacity to make waffles and have a selection of Jimmy Dean Bacon or Sausage and Egg muffins that can be microwaved.
The rooms have been totally re-done and they are comfortable, roomy, and very nicely appointed. Mine came with a King sized bed, a comfortable easy chair and ottoman, a work desk and chair that were very comfortable and functional, the usual flat panel cabled TV, new carpeting, a small fridge and microwave, and all the other amenities that usually come with a room (coffee maker, hair dryer, etc.). Internet access was easy and the signal was strong.
My room overlooked the courtyard, and that was especially impressive. New french doors ensure a clear view of the courtyard but if you are so inclined you can open them, access a small balcony, and take in the sights and sounds below, to include the water fountain, palm trees, flowers and bushes, etc. The pool and sauna areas have been renovated as well, and are in the courtyard itself.
As regards my interaction with the staff and the manager of the hotel, I was impressed. They were always responsive, friendly and accommodating and certainly made me feel at home while away from home.
Lastly, and the real kicker, is their location, which is directly adjacent to Old Town. I would estimate a walk of no more than two or three blocks to get into Old Town. The property is just off I-5 but you won't notice noise from the highway. The entire property is "gated" so you should feel safe, with the surrounding area being upscale and very nice.
I would highly recommend this hotel to the business traveler, to families and to those who want a pleasant stay with very nice accommodating staff. It's location is ideal and the improvements to the property are impressive.
Excellent collection and clarity

We travel a lot and therefore we fly a lot. Singapore airlines surprise us in the good way. Their service is great, the food is good and the crew works harder then any other cabin crew we have seen before. So if posible we will fly Singapore airlines always.

Chat GPT as an app has redefined learning and make every day to day task very easy to carry out by simplifying even the most complex of tasks and especially making it easy to get a new fantastic view of learning and comprehension. I will give it five star and more stars.

UX is not perfect, but nothing ever is. So I would say it's about as good as it gets. UI needs a bit of work. May want to unit test re-searching from the "Search Results" page on Android. When attempting to input a new search from the prior search's results screen, the keyboard is activated. However, the input is never populated in the search field, resulting in an empty field. The only remedy I've found is to back out to home and start a new search.

We were so glad we chose to stay at the Westin for our weekend in N.Y.C. From check-in to check-out, the whole experience was wonderful. The staff was extremely friendly... we were able to switch to a 2-bed room at the last minute and were on one of the preferred floors with an incredible view of Times Square. The room was very clean and comfortable and the shower (double shower heads) was great. The concierge was very helpful in directing us regarding transportation and activities. Overall, it was a great stay and we would definitely stay there again!

Easily the best BBQ in Phoenix. They deserve every 5 star review. Brisket is good as the best in Texas. Ribs were excellent. Just everything about the place. I would give them $10 just to smell.\n\nMeat by the pound. One minor quibble. I like whole ring hot links. But the beans were spectacular. I was in BBQ coma land for the rest of the afternoon. Oh, get the pastrami on Thursdays. It's silly good.

Reviewers seems quite divided on this property. My experience was largely positive, certainly considering my expectations after reading some of the reviews. I am a Hilton Gold, so I suspect that I got one of the better rooms. It was certainly comparable to big city Hiltons in other cities. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom fully functional. I didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff, but all interactions were positive. The fitness room was not too big, but not a problem at 8 in the evening.
I was advised at check in that construction would be going on between 9 and 5. I was only briefly in my room in this window. I would hear construction noise in the hallway, but not in my room.
I did eat the brunch on morning and was underwhelmed. There was an egg preparation station, which I probably should have used. Instead, I had some of the prepared dishes and they seemed a bit greasy. The service was attentive and friendly.
Amazing gym! Coaches are great! Their open gym and summer camp are great programs! Hands down best place in AZ for gymnastics!

I have tears in both rotator cuffs and have a lot of pain. I thought this was just another gimmick but am willing to try practically anything for some relief. It came in the mail super fast. I took it out of the package and my first thought was "What a pleasant smell". No plastic. Not overpowering. Just a waft of lavender. It is super soft and the feel is excellent. I tried it straight out of the box - no heating, no cooling. Oh. My. God. Just the warmth of the material, the scent & the weight were enough to give me some relief. I can't wait to try it heated up if it feels this good right now. I will definitely be ordering several more for family members for gifts!

Really great food and great service. The staff is always friendly. I'd recommend getting the chicken pasta salad, Philly chicken pita, or, if you're really hungry, the curry chicken salad. Also, their lemonade is on point...not that minute maid crap.

I love love love XS!
Anyone who is going to Vegas for their first time needs to go to this club. I have only been to Vegas twice and though I have not been to a wide variety of clubs, I know what I like and agree with what everyone else has to say! Sad to say that they close off the pool area once fall hits and definitely hinders the experience. But since I came around spring break the cabanas were cracking and the pool was so pretty. I love how XS welcomes you to put your feet in and lounge around the pool. This was greatly appreciated after going to surrender last night, where they constantly yelled at you for even touching the water. 

XS blows every club out of the water and those who know anything about Vegas will come here. When the cabanas are not open, XS could definitely open up so more bars because it was super packed and hard to get drinks last time.

Our family had a brief weekend trip to Boston and were fortunate enough to stay here. The hotel itself is gorgeous, the rooms are much bigger than we anticipated which was wonderful, but the service in this hotel far exceeds anything else. Everyone was so accommodating, any request was granted and with a smile--it was such a pleasure staying here. If you are able to get a room at this hotel I would not look any further you will not be disappointed! We also had dinner at The Island Creek Oyster Bar which was divine. Truly a great trip!

Had our 37' Safari diesel pusher towed here for brake work. A-1 towing out of Laughlin was amazing! The service at Freightliner was fantastic. Blair and Gilles were very caring and professional. Work was done professionally and in a timely manner. Price was reasonable. Would highly recommend this facility for any issue you may have with your motorhome. Many thanks again Blair and Gilles. You made a very stressful situation manageable. Thanks for your great work. Our very best to you in the future.

Little Bohemian has been my massage therapist for about 4 years now and I can highly recommend her. She is doing an outstanding job and knows what your body needs. I have consulted her when being stressed out, worn out, as well as after accidents and every time I leave her massage studio I am feeling MUCH better.

Besides getting an amazing massage Little Bohemian is able to give you a lot of helpful tips on how to be nicer to your body due to her being a yoga instructor as well.

The facility itself she is working out of is very clean and professional while giving you a cozy and welcoming feeling.

I can recommend Little Bohemian and have done so for years.

If you're looking to stay in a beautiful, historic, convenient to the sights hotel, with the absolute best concierge (Guilliarme) in any hotel we've ever stayed anywhere in the US & Europe, book now while the weather is good, and kids are in school! The term "lobbyist" was coined there by Ulysses Grant, who liked to hang out there, as well as Abraham Lincoln. The bar is warm and friendly, with the famous patrons' portraits watch you ingest your wonderful drinks and appetizers. The rooms aren't the fanciest decor in the world, but the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in, in ages. The hotel restaurant, Cafe du Parc, has really good food, although it's seating is cramped and the service is really slow. Love this hotel!

Just concluded another stay at the Stoneleigh and wanted to share some comments on this somewhat unknown jewel of a hotel. First, the service - each time I arrive the valets know me by name, have a smile and ask if they can help, this has never happened to me in any other hotel (as a result I've gotten to know them well) and is a great first impression for the Stoneleigh. I don't know if the staff has daily training on arriving guests or they just have a naturally great staff, but from the front desk to the concierge to bartender and Bolla waitstaff they provide great service with a smile and most seem to know me by name.
I eat breakfast there on occasion when time permits (Texas Benedict is truly unique and also wonderful), and asked for a slight change to the menu item one time, since that time, I've been asked without fail "would you like the Texas Benedict as you ordered before?". Again, this is unique in my experience and speaks to both the tenure and professionalism of the staff.
A quick review of the room itself:
They rooms are very nice with comfortable beds and great linens, and the soaring ceilings of a property built long ago. Although there are many different room configurations, and all the rooms I've stayed in are spacious with very good closet space and a super nice bathroom including great toiletries. The walls are thick and I've never been bothered by noise from a guest next door. As expected in hotel in this category there are nice flat screen TVs and reliable wi-fi. One of the most important qualities in a hotel is cleanliness and the Stoneleigh staff does a great job - my room is always sparkling and fresh. I could go on about all the other items that make for a great hotel - have never run out of hot water, plenty of water pressure in the shower, etc.
The hotel lobby and bar are uique and have great seating which is unusual and ecletic, but provides for good people watching. The bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly.
The hotel has kept the qualities of its heritage while integrating technology, and providing great service. Stay here once and you'll be back!
One important item to me is cleanliness

I'd heard about Spinato's for some time, but never found myself in the neighborhood to stop in and try it...until yesterday...WOW!! I can't comment on the dining-in service, but I definitely have something to say about the pizza! 

Some say it's hard to mess up a pizza, and other say pizza preferences are personal. What I loved about the pizza here was that the sauce was not too salty, not too sweet, and not too tomatoe-y/out of a can tasting. It was perfect! The cheese also quality and aplenty. I haaaaate when places skimp on the cheese. The toppings were great and also not sparse. The pizza didn't have an inch of grease on it and didn't have that soggy middle bottom like some places leave their pizzas. The crust was thin enough so that you didn't feel like you might as well have ordered a bread basket, but not so thin that you felt like you were eating off a cracker. 

As Chicagoans, we had the Chicago pizza...fantastic!!! I can't wait to come back here again and try their other pizzas and calzones. So happy I was introduced to the greatness that is Spinato's!!

i booked this hotel because it said it was pet friendly, put when i checked in they said they did not allow pet's. think goodness i had printed off the online info showing it being pet friendly. The room was clean, local was great for the Alamo and River walk. pool was very small. free breakfast was just okay. price was very good. would stay again if i dont have to bring my dog.

Great app, good for listening music although I have a problem turning off the dumb shuffle... Watch lots and lots of tutorials for it but i find nothing in my Spotify playlist and such. Overall this app is great, still trying to turn off the stupid shuffle though.
Had what I wanted, ordered Sunday morning and delivered in less than 24 hours. Faultless performance thank you

We stayed one night, too bad! Staff is friendly, not snotty or stuffy like some fancy hotels. They speak to you like they are your respectful friends - real people! The valet parking guys were a hoot and we had fun with them. Christina at the front desk was very helpful and nice. The room was very large, huge windows, great bathroom with a fantastic tub, great make-up mirror (designer) and very high ceilings. Liked the location much better than right on the water and not as "snooty" as that area where the Four Seasons is. The restaurant in the hotel has unique and inventive food - highly recommend it! Interesting history of the hotel. Highly recommend it, will stay here again!

We stayed in a twin room that was tiny and in need of a facelift but for the price we paid it was more than adequete.
The location of the Milford Plaza is really excellent being one street away from Times Square so as a shopping base it is really ideal. We had issue with noisy neighbours on one night but it was dealt with straight away by security and we had no other issues.
We stayed on the 10th floor which has yet to be renovated but I really look forward to returning when it is completed.

I've never been to d'loovi's yet but the food smells so good my stomach grumbles from up here in England. As for the atmosphere I've seen it on the net and wished I was there instead of here .And as for the owner /host well what can I say but we've been friends forever and I don't think you could ask for a kinder upstanding one .For all those lucky enough to visit I'm green with envy !!!

Sin city smashburgerrrr... yum \nLove this place. Seems like its always busy so you might have to wait. I usually pick up because the tables are full. \nVeggie frites are awesome and the chocolate malts too.

I'd heard about this movie, but didn't see it until my daughter, who saw it on a flight to Australia, told me it was a great movie. I was interested in seeing whether Rupert Grint, away from Harry Potter, was showing the promise you see in the Potter movies. I wasn't disappointed. He's become a fine actor, showing a range in Driving Lessons from a shy boy being beaten down by an over-bearing obsessive mother, to a young man finding himself to be worthy of his own, and other's, esteem. Going over lines from plays and poetry with his aging-actress employer, it's obvious that he's ready to take on much more complex roles in films and the stage. But the jewel of this movie was Julie Walters. I'd seen her previously in the Potter movies, Billy Elliott and Calendar Girls, and loved her. In Driving Lessons, as she does lines from poetry and Shakespeare, I was awed by her timing, command of the language, and body language. I'm hoping it was make-up/costuming, as she portrays an older woman with osteoporosis, though no mention of it is made in the movie-- as a nurse, I can say that she did this perfectly, portraying a woman on the brink of old-age, but clinging to the sparkling past that she reveled in. This is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time, and I wish I'd seen it in a theatre first-- but I doubt it ever played anywhere here in Albuquerque. We miss out on so many of these types of movies here.

Ahh, the secret pizza place. On my most recent trip to Vegas I remember stumbling into your cheesy grotto back to back nights. Their white pizza is to die for! Nice thin and crispy slices, perfectly balanced sauce, and fresh ricotta was divine. I will seek you out again.

Wow. If you like music, you will LOVE the MIM. This place is amazing! Perhaps I should say if you like music OR architecture, you will love the MIM. This is the kind of place that as you walk through, you mutter to yourself, "I can't believe I am in Phoenix!" The MIM now is affiliated with the Smithsonian Museums, and after touring the facility, you will agree that is a perfect partnership.

I don't want to repeat what has already been said on the great reviews, so instead I will just reiterate that you really need at LEAST three hours to see the MIM. That three hours will mean you have not seen everything, but it's a start. The MIM has a really nice cafe with limited hours, but has a coffee shop which is open throughout the day. In addition, there is a gorgeous music venue which you can take a peek at while on your adventure. It looks like a perfect place to catch a show, and much like the rest of the MIM, it is eye candy.

The staff at MIM are very knowledgeable and super friendly. The audio system you wear while on your musical quest is really outstanding. The sound was superior, and makes Bose look like dollar store speakers. Lastly, don't miss the gift store, there are tons of great items there, and I found my Mom a little Mother's day gift. DO NOT MISS seeing John Lenin's piano which he played Imagine on. It will give you goosebumps!

 Hope you enjoy your visit.

We've stayed here before and had a great experience so we came back for my 42nd birthday. We managed to secure an upgrade to a corner suite (not sure if that was because of our Starwood membership level or because it was my birthday but I was happy either way)!
The room was identical to the one we stayed at for my 40th. However, we had one major issue - the bathroom stank of smoke. Being non-smokers and with a 5 year old in tow, it was an issue. We called Front Desk and they arranged for a guy with a humidifier/atomiser type device run that in the bathroom for 30 mins while we had dinner in the restaurant. While eating dinner, the duty manager came over to apologise and gave us a $40 credit against breakfast which was very good service in my opinion.
The restaurant is very nice and the food was good as was the service.
On returning to our room, the smell in the bathroom was unfortunately still there but as it was late we left the issue till the morning.
The next day we decided we would have to change rooms as the smell was still bad and we were there for another 4 nights still. We called Front Desk and asked if we could change to an upgraded room or at least the same room type. They did not have an upgraded room for us (supposedly) but were happy to help us move to the same room type. My wife went to check out the room before we moved. She was happy with it so we packed all our suitcases once again and had someone pick them up to move them over.
The new room was similar to our old one but better as it seemed more spacious. And no smell!
We had great views and the room was very comfortable. So much so, my daughter rarely wanted to leave! We also had great fun playing on the table-top arcade game in the lobby which reminded me of my child-hood days!
My wife and I had a few drinks in the lobby bar too which was nice.
One warning, the bar does get noisy and busy in the evening so not quite as family-friendly at that point but still ok.
I used the onsite Bliss Spa for a facial while there (my birthday treat from the missus!) which was lovely. The only point I'd add is that the relaxation room where you wait before your treatment could use a few more amenities. The treatment itself, and the attendant carrying it out, were both great. Expensive but worth it!
We also used the Accura Experience a few times. This is a car service which you can book at the Accura desk near Concierge. They have a nice new, Accura that can take you anywhere within quite a large radius. You just have to watch an in-car video and fill out a survey on an iPad. The driver was very friendly. You just pay tips. Much better than a taxi! We didn't try getting them to pick us up and bring us back as that seemed a bit too cheeky!
They also arranged a delicious chocolate cake slice for my birthday which was really tasty!
Overall, a great visit, despite the issues. I'm sure we will be back again!

It takes about 5 min walk to be at the center of Times Square and 3 min walk to the Central Park, which means you'll always have something to do. It's a huge hotel, like anything else in NYC. Staff is helpfull, and problems get fixed really quickly. Wi-fi is charged, but just across the street there's a Starbucks coffe with free wi-fi, you just have to wait a while to get a seat.
Room was good and warm. If you don't like heating systems you can open the window. The bathroom was not the cleanest, but you can take a good hot shower.
Good selection, but serving slow cause steam on the spot .

I generally avoid buffets. They're just not my thing. However, I was seriously craving some Indian food for lunch today, and I'd had this place bookmarked to try. All I can say is that I'm glad I broke my buffet rule and gave India Oven a spin. This place was phenomenal!!! Hot food, great quality and stellar service...all three things I usually find buffet joints lacking in. The garlic naan was probably the best naan I've ever had. Go here. You will not be disappointed.
Good food, courteous staff but expensive
WhatsApp is the perfect text app. The developer is constantly making awesome changes. I don't think it's ever been buggy with any update in the 10 years I've used it.

I recently spent 4 nights at my favorite hotel- Four Seasons, Austin, TX - and was absolutely blown away by the consistency of the quality and attention to detail by its management and staff. Every aspect of my stay from check in to check out was handled with a smile and made me feel as if I was the most important guest on the property. However, I am certain that other guests received similar treatment. The pool and spa services were fantastic and as always the food was remarkable. And I cannot say enough about the staff- always helpful and always working hard to ensure a pleasant stay.

Red Velvet Cupcakes....Ya'll for real dude! They have some Red Velvet cupcakes in this Walgreens, that is just as good as any cupcake place in town for about $1.95. They also have a pack of small ones, there like bite size, I you get 12 in the container, for $2.00. My husband has more of a sweet tooth than me, so he has to order them. Matter of fact, they just call him now, when a new shipment comes in. And they will put some aside for him.

This is a fantastic spot. 

The big secret? The best out door area in plaza midwood. It is incredible.

Of course they have great music, shows, karaoke...but they also have an area to watch debates during the political seasons.

The drinks are strong. The people are cool. This is a favorite.
Has been and always will be my favorite music app

5 stars for the excellent service and delicious food! Everything we had was great but the one thing that stood out for me was the Green Chile Mac 'N Cheese!! Thanks to all previous yelpers for this recommendation! : ) Neither the green chile nor the cheese was overpowering but with each bite, there was definitely a \"kick\" to it! YUMMY!!!! I am now on a mission to get that recipe!!! : )

There are so few restaurants that deserve a 5-star rating, but Razz is undoubtedly one of them. While the exterior of the building appears nondescript, the interior is tastefully decorated and replete with artwork hanging on the walls. We always make a reservation to sit at the chef's table and everything we've ever had has been phenomenal. My husband and I have very diverse tastes and are willing to try just about anything, but I can honestly say that beef tongue is probably not something that we would ever have ventured to taste had it not been served to us here. It's now one of our favorite dishes, as is the \"macaroni and cheese\" with lobster and crab meat. \n\nThe wine selection is great as well and we typically ask Razz to recommend a bottle and have never been disappointed. It's so clear that Razz is an incredibly talented chef who is doing what he loves to do! The restaurant does close over the summer so we will be eagerly awaiting its reopening in the fall to try some more of Razz's amazing creations.

We recently took a weekend getaway to Phoenix and stayed here. The Hotel is beautiful and our rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The staff here are topnotch. I love the lobby wine & hot apple cider hour in the afternoons, and the lobby coffee & hot chocolate bars in the mornings. We had access to the Golds Gym across from the hotel and were able to get a good workout in their cardio theatre. There is an outdoor skating rink right outside and a small shopping/dining area. It is located right across from the stadium and could walk to our event. I would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you are attending an event at the arena.

For me a hotel room is just a place to sleep and shower, and I don't pay much attention to the details so this is my first hotel review. My room was inconveniently across the street from the office. The first thing I noticed was the bed offset from the base. I had to lift up my friend's bed so he could push in a metal bar in that was sticking out. All the lamps in the room were connected to the same wall switch. Wireless internet strength varied for me. My friend logged onto another open network. There was no remote for the TV. The radio/clock was broken and unable to be set. The bathroom light was on a timer with no fan. Even after crossing the street and speaking to the front desk, the phone had no dial tone. Hotel info said the place had been refurbished in 2008, since then dust bunnies had been multiplying behind the bathroom door under the peeling wallpaper.

My wife and I just spent the weekend in Austin for a friends wedding and there were some horrible experiences for much of the wedding party during our time at the Driskill hotel.
One member of the wedding party was told he was being upgraded when he checked in, upgraded meaning he was given a room on a higher floor. What they didnt mention is that his air conditioning didnt work. When he attempted to move to another room he was told there werent any available for him, instead they said they could help him make a reservation somewhere else.
Another friend of ours got locked out of his room so they sent the maintenance guy up to help out, he attempted to use our friends key which obviously didnt work and then tried the master key which also didnt work. The maintenance guy said he would "be right back"... 30 minutes later nobody had returned. Our friend then goes to the front desk again and a member of security went through the same steps, master didnt work nor did our friends key. Again the Driskill employee says "be right back"... another 30 minutes pass and nobody returns. Our friend then checked out and got his bags the next day when they finally got access to his room. He was only given a 50% refund.
Last of all, after our shuttle ride from the ceremony back to the Driskill for the reception, I get off of the bus with a beer in hand. I met my wife at the bar and set my beer on the bar while I removed my coat, the bartender instantly came over and snagged my beer and told me no outside beverages. I then went upstairs to the reception and got a beer from the open bar and came back down to the bar with it and sat down next to my wife. He came over and said the same thing to me and tried to take my beer. I replied right after I moved the beer out of his reach, "this isn't an outside beverage sir, I got it from the bar upstairs", smiled and winked at him.
I must say that the hotel itself was beautiful, but the service was absolutely horrible not to mention the eye gauging prices! $25 for a fruit plate and OJ for breakfast!!!
Enjoy paying a lot of money for a hotel room and like to be treated like dirt, I do not recommend staying here ever. There are two marriott properties about 2 blocks away, residence and courtyard.
very good app but it laggs when asked in other languages expect english

Booked a two day family mini-break around the labor day holiday. Loved the setting of hotel - just outside of San Antonio in the hill country. Sweeping vistas and quietness make you forget just how close to town you really are.
The hotel offers lots of activities ranging from golf and bicycle tours for adults to campfire smors and ping-pong for kids and young adults. And of course, one of the biggest attractions are the 3 water slides, lazy river, splash park and multiple pools that appeal to all ages.
The remoteness of the resorts means you will likely be eating several meals at the on-site restaurants. I found the service and quality of food were a bit uneven; great some times, and average at others. For a JW branded hotel, I would have expected both service and quality to have consistently delivered quality and service that are above average.
We did not take advantage of the on-site spa or golf course.
Overall, we had a terrific time. It was nice to have an resort with so many activities to choose from. The price for the room was a bit higher than I would have expected for the unevenness of the service and food quality that was delivered.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in MAY 2011 (late review I know!) and it was better than I expected. My husband is a diamond elitem rewards member so we stay with this chain alot, I booked this based on the pictures on the Best Western website. When we arrived we were prompty checked in and assigned a room in the newer building, it was clean and quiet. We were impressed with the location, right accross from the marina and water on either side. We were walking the grounds one night a saw a mamma duck sitting on her babies to keep them warm, super cute! Pool was clean and there is a nice fireplace to chat by the pool. Staff was helpful when needed. Wouldn't hesistate in staying here again!

When in Montreal, take advantage of the presence of its many North African restaurants. The food was great! The meal ( lunch at least) came with an appetizer, a tagine, and some delightful baklava and mint tea for dessert. I ordered a chicken tagine that had olives and couscous mixed in. It was awesome. My friend ordered a vegetarian tagine which had peanut sauce and some veggies mixed in it. I tried a bit of her dish and it was delicious as well. I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant,the decor is beautiful and the owner is very friendly.

Stayed here for one night in July 2008. We booked on Priceline for $102/night. For the money, this was a very nice hotel. One complaint would be the $22/night valet or self parking fee. Since there is absolutely nothing around this resort, there is no options but to park your car here and pay the crazy rate. Internet is $13 a day but I think you can get free wireless around the pool. The pool area is nice. There are a couple jacuzzi's, a kid's pool and a big pool. There are cabana's to rent for 75/day weekdays or 120/day weekends for the whole day. Overall, the pool area was very nice. Looked at the beach, but its not a beach to lay around and relax but to do water activities or biking. Our rooms were on the 6th floor in the tower. We had a view of the bay as well as the 9:50pm fireworks show at Seaworld. Fireworks lasted around 5 minutes and that was a good fringe benefit of the room. The room came with 2 beds, desk, chair, refrigerator for your things and safe. The bathroom was clean and small but functional. Plenty of towels. We stayed in 2 rooms and one them was not available until 4:30pm. Check in time is 4:00. Check out time is 12 noon. Staff is very nice. If the price is right, I would stay here again.

i recently stayed here and we booked through the bellagio-mgm-mirage site. got an awesome lake view room and you can see paris right in front of you its beautiful. room service is awesome the 2.5 lb steamed lobster was so good. the omlette was disappointingly dry! the garden next to the lobby was beautiful as usual and the themes always change so theres always something new to gasp your eyes upon each trip there.

After reading all of the reviews, I was skepitcal, but booked anyway. Was I glad I did! When we arrived, we were promptly greeted at the desk and checked in. We were given a room on the fourth floor with a king size bed of the main building.
I was amazed when we got to the room and saw how big it was. I was ready for a cramped hotel room with a bed, a tv, and maybe a desk to put a computer on. Surprised does not even begin to cover it. The room was LARGE with a king size bed and a sofa. There was a enough room to do excercises if you were so inclined. The room did face North Point and Columbus, which could get a a little loud at times, but if you spent all day out and about walking and enjoying the city, you were so tired when you got back that you didn't hardly notice it.
The bed was comfortable, the pillows were not. The bathroom was an average size hotel bathroom, which was all we needed. There was free wireless access in the rooms, which wasn't that fast, but it was adequate to surf the web and look at email. There was also computer access with printers on the 5th floor which we took advantage of at one point. There is also a computer in the lobby by the elevators to check in for your flight and print out boarding passes if you wanted to.
The staff was friendly and helpful. We did not eat the breakfast mainly because of the reports from everyone else on here. There was however, a very good place, Pergaminos, across the street that was absolutely wonderful fo breakfast.
At this hotel, you are 2 blocks from being on Fisherman's Wharf. Directly behind the hotel is a Hertz and Avis rental store if you want to rent a car. Also, you are two blocks from the cable car turn around, which was great. We were able to eat breakfast, walk to the cable cars, and ride them to Union Square in a very short amount of time. Also, you're only a couple of blocks from Ghiradelli Square, which has great ice cream if you are interested.
Overall, a very good hotel with great rooms and great service convenient to just about anything and everything you want to do.

My BFF and I just found this place even though he has lived around the corner for 25 years. Food was fabulous. I had cheese burger and fries, he had a skillet breakfast with bisquits and gravy. Waitress was a sweety, helpful and attentive. Coffee wasn't the best tasting but was served generously. Prices are great too! Wish they had cocktails!

I love these books. Yes, they can be a bit too pat at times, the characters pretty predictable, but still... delvers, shags, cliff behemoths, river rogues, hook hawks, and many many more - you have to give credit for creativity where it's due!! I've read my share of fantasy and never come across HALF the creatures in this series. I particularly enjoy the qualities of the delver!That is the ONLY reason I'm still reading them. The writing is just atrocious. Then is frequently used for Than. Most compound words are separated: he said so any way, she decided to cook some thing, they rose above ground, etc. It drives me insane. There's also a lot of redundancy; the author doesn't seem to have a very large vocabulary (or a thesaurus!!): he remains standing among the remaining guards still, etc. As you see, repeating the word AND re-stating the concept. If he remains there, obviously he's there still, so why add it to the end and make it awkward? Also, many sentences just don't make sense. Either they seem to be missing words, they seem to have extra words, or they seem unfinished.There are still other grammatical/spelling errors, but this is getting pretty long. As you can see, those things bother me a great deal. Imagine how interesting this world must be for me to continue reading! I'm currently on book 4, and I've marked 158 mistakes at the 23% mark but am still enjoying it!

I travelled to Seattle with my children (7 & 10) for a performance at the 5th Avenue theatre. I must admit that I booked through priceline and got a great price and from reading other reviews I expected service on par with what I paid. I did not get this at all. From the time we arrived (early check in at 1pm) we were served with a smile and exeptional attitude. When I acknowledged that we were early but hoped to be able to change before heading to a matinee performance at the theatre the lady at the front desk genuinely seemed happy to let us check in early. I asked if our room had 2 beds as per my email request and it did. The only mention of the fact that I had purchased the room through priceline was a mention that the room was already paid for.
Our room was on the 25th floor and afforded us a slight view of the water and a great view of the Westin (where my husband and I usually stay when we travel alone to Seattle). The room met our needs - it was clean and well appointed but not the luxurious feel of the Westin rooms we have stayed in.
The housekeeping supervisor knocked on our door and asked if she could check the caulking in the bathroom. She was quick to say she could certainly return if the time was not convenient. Her friendly attitude and offer of more towels when she noted that there were 3 of us in the room (it was already made up with towels for 3) and more coffee was just a signal as to why she occupied her management role.
While in Seattle we visited the Market a couple of times and the Sheraton's location is fantastic...when we are at the Westin it is a steep climb up a hill to return to the hotel but with the Sheraton it is such a gentle incline one barely notices they are walking uphill.
We ate in the hotel at the Daily Grill for supper and were pleasantly surprised. I had expected a more casual dining experience from the reviews I had read but my hazelnut crusted mahi mahi was prepared very well. The selection of wine was expansive and well priced for any budget. The children's meals were very much to the liking of my girls. The service we received was timely and friendly - noting that it was 7 when we entered the restaurant our waiter asked if we had any time constraints ( a nice touch for a family if they need to eat quickly or get to a theatre production or game).
We used the pool for a 1/2 hour on Saturday after dinner since it was occupied by older teenagers playing pass in the pool and young adults getting cozy in the hottub. Several other families arrived during that time frame.
On Sunday morning we got up and headed to the pool by 8:30; there were several families playing and others who were swimming laps. Warning:The hot tub was murky so we got out quite quickly.
From the valets to the reception desk to the restaurant staff and beyond the service made the Sheraton one of the shining stars of our weekend. Thanks for a great stay!!

My husband and I spent 2 nights at the W over President's weekend for our anniversary. I had read the reviews, but we got a very attractive rate, and figured the issues had just been isolated. Unfortunately, many of the negative comments I had read were right on the money... Room design is poor... it's a small room with nowhere for 2 people to comfortably lounge, other than the on the bed. We wanted to hang out in the room and watch the olympics while having a drink, but it wasn't at all conducive. Walls are horribly thin - we were awoken both nights by noisy people in rooms around us. Guy singing in the shower next door at 6:30 a.m. sounded like he was in our room. The open window between the bath and bed was just weird... We weren't horribly undone by it, but I can see how it could be a huge issue for people who practice discretion. Housekeeping was not efficient - one day the cleaner left her Monster energy drink in our room, and another she failed to change out dirty wine glasses. A tray of leftover room service food sat in our hallway for at least 20 hours... Valet service was not efficient either - we tried to call ahead and have our car brought up, but were refused and told we had to come down with our ticket before they would retrieve it. I would only stay again if rate was $150/night or less.

With its rerelease by ADV Films, I've had a chance to watch "The Giant Majin" for the first time without the deep cuts and unkind words of a late night Horror Chiller Theaters. Guess what? It's a pretty damn good movie!The sets are authentic, the acting in subdued and believable, and the giant Majin is stately, powerful, and unstopable. I loved the subtle fantasy touches (the enchanted wood, luck charm, etc), and the potrayal of the god as a little less than 'good'.This movie is begging for a remake in the new century!

My first time at Serrano and I am very impressed with the location. Let it be business or tourism, staying at this hotel will put you bang in the center of downtown. Very close to Powell BART station (0.5 miles) and about 0.4 miles to get a ride on the world famous cable car. Westfield mall is 0.5 miles too. The intersection of Powell and Market Street where all the shopping is, is only 0.5 miles.
Close to market street means it is a bit far to the touristy locations of Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Pier 39, Embarcadero road etc. All the destinations are around 2 miles from the hotel.
Regarding food, never had in Serrano's restaurant but there are plenty of restaurants catering to all variety of people around Serrano. You will get almost all the cuisines around Serrano. That is not a problem at all.
Regarding the staff, they are OK. They could do a better job, be more friendly. That doesn't mean they have done a bad job, they are there for whatever you want, but they could be a bit more friendly.
The rooms are medium sized with flat screen televisions. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is adequate. If you have 3 to 4 big suitcases, it might be a bit cramped but majority of the rooms in San Francisco are of this size.
One thing I was really disappointed about this place is Wifi. It is complimentary but sucks big time. It is slow by US standards and is very inconsistent, by far the worst internet experience I have had in all the hotels I stayed. Terrible, without this problem I would have rated the hotel 4/5.

I've stayed at the Park Central in the past (although I couldn't find my review).... and I had recommended it to everyone that I knew was going to New York. I wasn't as impressed this time. We stayed for one night, Sunday in early May.
We waited quite a while in the checkin line and there were two desk agents standing at the front desk that weren't helping guests - I don't mind a line, but I do not like waiting when others are standing by idle, they shouldn't be in customer's view. The rate we were offered included a restaurant and attractions discount card, but it wasn't provided upon checkin and I didn't remember it until we were already out on the town. Checking out was efficient.
When we asked Bell Staff about taking the train to Newark, they really discouraged it and instead promoted the town car or taxi. It's about a $6 fare to Penn Station and the train was actually very convenient, even with all our luggage.
The room itself was clean but it looked a bit tired, the wallpaper was bubbling in the corner. Not a showstopper. But, the in room safe was locked. I called down to have it unlocked and we waited around for an hour then finally left with all our valuables in tow. We returned 6 hours later to find the safe still locked. The desk agent apologized for the inconvenience when we checked out. Internet worked great, allowed 3 devices for the 24 hour charge.
We ate in the restaurant.... they had a great 3 course lunch special. Very reasonably priced. Unfortunately the lounge wasn't open when we were there (Sunday??), otherwise we would have enjoyed a drink there.
I managed to re-book the room closer to our stay and get a much cheaper rate (about $135)! I would have been disappointed if I had paid more for the room given the quality of accommodations/service.

I called Vladimir after finding him on Yelp for a washing machine issue. The clutch was going out on it. Vladimir called me back with the price of the part, $375. I told him to get it and come on out. He made an appointment with me, was on time, looked at my washer, prepared to install the new part, and then saw that my motor was leaking grease from the bearings onto the clutch housing. He told me that it was an expensive fix, and that if he installed the new part, it would only last a few months and then I would be back where I started. I had him put it back together without the new part, and while he was there, he also looked at my dishwasher, and told me how to fix it myself for cheap, and told me my under the counter wine cooler would be very expensive to fix, and that I would be better off buying a new wine cooler while I was buying the new washer. He was honest, could have installed the part and charged me $500, but instead he charged me the service call and a small fee for lubricating the clutch while he had it out. We were very impressed with Vladimir after some of the \"professionals\" we have dealt with over the past several years. He's now on our speed-dial as our appliance repair guy.

Our emergency trip to DC had us choosing any hotel that was near our son's home and Washington Hospital Center. Because they indicated parking we chose this hotel. Beware, if you drive, parking may not be available on weekends. We had to park at a different hotel and pay $40 plus walk back 30 minutes. If we had known this we would have not gotten a vehicle. But with our visits to the hospital we thought it would be more convenient with our own transportation. We ended up leaving the car at the hospital and using taxi service. The staff were very accommodating, we ordered from their room service close to closing, but the food was excellent. We had a corner suite with pull out sofa, also kitchen that had stove top, microwave and a few dishes. I would stay here again, just not with a vehicle.

My husband was joining me for a few days of personal stay & the Hilton would not give us a reasonable rate, so I found this hotel thru Priceline...and moved...rolling my suitcase 4 blocks. Comfortable beds, quite, easy to sleep. Very convenient...anytime of day!

We booked this hotel over the Labor Day weekend (Saturday to Monday). I decided to try Washington Plaza based on the price and the reviews on tripadvisor. We were definitely not disappointed. The hotel has recently been updated so the decor is very modern with a large outdoor pool with plenty of lounge chairs, pool bar and outside dining. It also has a restaurant and lounge area. We visited both and were pleased with the food and drinks. The bartenders were great! The hotel also has conference facilities. Our room was on the 4th floor and overlooked the pool and Thomas Circle. The staff was very accommodating. The hotel offers self park as well as valet parking. We used valet parking which was $29 per night. I'm not sure what the self park price would've been. Rooms were very modern and clean with a nice sized bathroom. The McPherson Square metro stop was a 10 minute walk. There is also a 24 hour CVS across the street from the hotel which is very convenient. The White House was a 15 minute walk. Overall I would definitely recommend Washington Plaza. We plan on returning here on our next trip to DC.

Having read some of the mixed reviews on this hotel I was ready to ask for a new room even before I entered the building. When I went to reception the staff were friendly, quick and full of helpful information. The inside of the hotel was is a bit dated but I think it adds to the character. The rooms are not as small as I thought. We choose a non-smoking room and it was in good condition and very clean. The bathroom is small but adequate and again very clean. The location of the hotel is the main second to none. You walk out the front door and you are on Time Square. We went to the Lunt Fontane Theatre which is next door to the hotel and had a great experience of our first Broadway show. The hotel is very keenly priced for the location and I would suggest that this hotel is perfect for anyone who wants a central base in a clean and friendly environment.

I stayed at The Arizona Grand Resort Feb. 22-26. It is a quick 15 min trip from the PHX Airport. The property is beautiful with fabulous fountains and lush greens. The staff was top notch. Everyone was on their game. We had a great check in experience with Tim. The valets helped us figure out how to get the top down on our convertible. Our room overlooked the private waterpark for hotel guests. I was really impressed with the guards and staff in the water park. It had just opened for the season and everyone working there seemed like they knew what they were doing. It was very clean and seemed very safe. My kids had an unbelievable adventure. The restaurant at the hotel served a great buffet. The beds were great. The housekeepers did a great job. I really enjoyed myself and would highly recommend this hotel. It was a perfectly lovely getaway!

Rating: 7 out of 10. Directed by Barbet Schroeder. If you like Hitchcock's `Rope', then you will like this movie. `Murder by Numbers' stars Sandra Bullock as psychologically troubled yet brilliant police detective Cassie Mayweather. Her partner is Sam Kennedy, a non-discriminatory detective played by Ben Chaplin. The teenage killers are high school students Richard Haywood (Ryan Gosling) and Justin Pendleton (Michael Pitt). These young psychotics are out to prove their superiority by committing the perfect murder and getting away with it, but the nearness of capture is exciting and thrilling to at least one of the killers.The supporting characters include a police chief, an assistant district attorney, and the high school janitor that the killers pin the murder on. The movie reminds me of various `Hitchcock' movies crossed with the TV show `Law and Order'. We see a fair bit of police work and it is really interesting to see which clues the detectives follow and which ones they don't.The other plot in the movie relates to Cassie Mayweather's past and incarcerated ex-husband. Most viewers found this aspect of the movie unnecessary and slow moving, but I found this to the most intriguing part of the story.`Murder by Numbers' is a nicely crafted movie if you are looking for safe, or should I say dangerous, murder mystery. For more thrills and suspense, try `Se7en' or Hitchcock's `Dial M for Murder'.

We stayed here for 1 night between Christmas and New Year's in 2007. We were celebrating our anniversary, and I wanted to stay and eat on the Riverwalk for one night. I'm a native Texan and have been to San Antonio and the Riverwalk many times -- but I had never seen it lighted up for Christmas. I was truly beautiful. The hotel was very clean; we had a room overlooking the river (on about the 10th floor). It is not in the middle of all of the activity on the riverwalk, but certainly within about a 10 minute walk to it. We stayed there on a Thursday night -- and of couse it being the holidays, it was crowded -- but we did not feel nervous about walking back to the hotel late at night.
The Alamo Bowl was going on that weekend, so there were a lot of young college students there early. The Riverwalk was very crowded, but with our hotel being slightly away from it all, we did not hear any of the revelry that was going on late at night.
It was worth the trip, and we will definitely stay here again.

I've loved mysteries, ever since starting out as a girl with Nancy Drew. I eventually moved on to Agatha Christie, Arthur Conan Doyle, and Dorothy L. Sayers. I also love to read historical romance, especially Regency and Victorian.So how could I help loving the Lady Julia Grey books? Simple. I couldn't. The three books in this very nicely priced ebook bundle were much more mystery than romance, but that's okay. They were engaging and well constructed. The underlying romance -- which in these three books take Julia and Brisbane from first meeting to marriage -- is subtle but gripping. Brisbane is such a delicious, deeply layered character.

As much as I hate to disagree with the original poster, I found Asterix and the Vikings quite good, and a HUGE step above previous attempts at animating everyone's favorite Gaul.For someone not familiar with the famous comic series, the show would be hard to follow, but for those of us in the know, it's a pleasure to watch.First and foremost, the animation is far superior to earlier comic adaptations. You can tell they took the time and effort to really recapture the look and feel of the comics this time around.As mentioned, there are elements of other Asterix titles in the movie and I can see how fans of those titles might feel confused or a bit let down, but I was so caught up in actually seeing one of my favorite childhood comics faithfully represented on the screen, any qualms I had were minor by comparison. Minor spoilers follow...Asterix and his faithful friend Obelix travel north to rescue the nephew of their village chief, who has been captured by the Vikings. The Vikings think that by the boy teaching them about fear, they will be able to fly, thanks to some poorly worded advice from their village druid. In the process, the boy meets the Viking Chief's daughter Abba and they fall in love, etc etc etc... If my explanation sounds convoluted, don't worry.. The plot is easy to follow! Definitely a great buy.. You can purchase this DVD through Amazon France, but be warned.. Your DVD player probably won't be able to play it. I had to change the region setting on my computer to view it..

I love this place. Great spot for some basic food, yummy drinks. Service isn't always super fast but it's not a place for fast. Great spot to go with a friend and chill during the week. I highly recommends the hummus and fig salad.

Excellent food! I'm not a particular fan of Indian food but I must say that this is definitely the best I've ever tasted. Me and my fiancee came here for V-Day after hearing it was one of the most romantic restaurants in Vegas. The location (Sahara and Commercial Center) is a bit of a grungy area but we go there to eat at Komol's quite often so the less than romantic exterior didn't bother me too much. The interior is dimly lit and pretty cozy as well. We got seated right away and had our orders taken within the next 10 minutes. We had a vegetable (carrot, onion, and parsley) ensemble for our starter dishes which was quite spicy but very tasty. I also had the vegetarian stir fry which was brought out on a steaming hot plate and smelled just as good as it tasted! This dish had a typical stir fry 'onion-y' taste and came complete with cauliflower, red and green peppers, grilled tofu, and more parsley. My main dish was a vegetarian curry and it was awesome! I also had garlic naan and kashmiri naan which was also killer! The kashmiri naan was naan with a cherry-like filling and it wasn't too sweet, complementing the buttery naan exterior very nicely. I also had the rice pudding for dessert and it was standard like other rice puddings I've had before. Food aside, the service was pretty good. They were a bit slow in bringing our food out and that was a bit irritating. We were there for almost 2 hours and we are definitely not slow eaters! They got my order wrong three times during our visit. The wine was the wrong one and decided to let that one slide but they brought out the wrong appetizer and wrong curry. Still not sure how that happened, but I let them know I got the wrong dishes and they gladly replaced them with the right ones and pretty quickly, at that. They also added a 10% percent discount on our bill and gave us extra naan. Now that's service! We didn't ask for the discount or naan so that was a real pleasant surprise. They had a Valentine's special going so 4 dishes and a dessert with a glass of wine came out to be $40 a person which was actually pretty good considering the regular prices of the plates which averaged around $12 dollars each. Overall, the service was a little slow but good and the food was awesome. Definitely coming back to experience Namaste again in the future.

I've been living in Chandler for 7 years now. I go every chance I have the chance to. I am a sushi LOVER!!! I've eaten at every sushi place possible in AZ. No sushi place beats Mikado, hands down!! The service is always great! It always has a great atmosphere, they're very welcoming, and the food is great! I STRONGLY suggest anyone go here and try it! 

I always get the "STST" (shrimp tempura & crushed spicy tuna) & the "volcano" (California tempura roll & a diced mixture of sashimi) & the "salmon poppers" (jalapenos stuffed with salmon and deep fried & cut in half). I would really recommend this place! 

It will be worth it!!! (:

I am rather a fussy person, when it comes to tea and serving, I would like to give my compliments and utmost gratitude to Aida + tea Sifu from Chynna. There are great reviews on the location, service and value of this hotel already which I wholeheartedly agree with and will not repeat. One thing that really impressed me was the standby upgrade offers Yotel emails you a few days prior to check-in. I opted in for the cheapest upgrade at $14 a night to a corner view room. However when we arrived, there were no corner view rooms available. The check-in staff kindly upgraded us to a larger room but still only charging us the lower rate. Firstly, the staff are excellent - will assist you with whatever you need. We stayed for a weekend in a Penthouse Suite for about $350/night - a terrific value and a good size room for Manhatten and balcony was HUGE! Would I pay the regular rate of $850 for this room? Not a chance, but at $350 the room is a terrific value for what you get. The room is a little worn - the walls a little banged up and the ceiling tiles quite run down, but otherwise fabulous. The bathroom was great and the bath products very high end. The bed was very, very comfortable. The upper east side location is terrific - our first time out of time square and well worth it. My husband, who is very picky, said this is our new base when in NYC - a true compliment. You should know that there is no room service, but the attached restaurant, Serafina, is wonderful. Bottom line - if you can get a deal, the hotel is very worth it.

The Homewood Suites is very comfortable within walking distance to attractions and restaurants. There's a friendly, helpful front desk staff. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and is kept well stocked. If your stay is on a weekday the hotel offers a dinner buffet and complimentary wine and beer. Clean, comfortable rooms and very affordable rates for D.C. I'd stay here again in a minute.
